data: {"label_type": "punctuation", "lesson_id": "adjective", "title": "Adjectives — Punctuation Rules", "rules": [{"rule_id": "adj_coordinate_comma", "when": "Coordinate adjectives that equally modify a noun", "test": "You can swap the adjectives or insert 'and' between them.", "do": "Use a comma: 'a long, narrow alley' (= narrow, long alley; long and narrow alley)", "dont": "No comma for cumulative sequence where order matters: 'three large wooden crates'"}, {"rule_id": "compound_modifier_hyphen", "when": "Two+ words act together before a noun as one idea", "do": "Hyphenate: 'smoke-filled room', 'two-story house'", "dont": "Usually no hyphen after the noun: 'The room is smoke filled' (style varies)"}, {"rule_id": "predicate_adjective_commas", "when": "Adjective follows a linking verb (predicate position)", "do": "No comma needed: 'The dress was red.'", "note": "Commas may appear with nonessential phrases, not with the predicate adjective itself."}, {"rule_id": "stacking_density", "when": "Three or more adjectives before a noun", "do": "Prefer 1–2 sharp adjectives; if more, coordinate properly and consider rephrasing to avoid clutter."}], "notes": "Coordinate vs cumulative adjectives; hyphenation of compound modifiers; predicate adjectives after linking verbs; density guidance.", "source_file": "Adjective.md", "source_md5": "37c90061526b8fa6f44a7676746ba167", "last_modified_iso": "2025-09-30T16:42:26.828836Z"}
